section.title: Define a script variable - WbVarDef
section.para: This defines an internal variable which is used for variable substitution during SQL execution.
There are two possibilities to define a variable. The short syntax is: WbVarDef variable=value
The long syntax allows to variables in a different way:

row.entry: The name of the variable to be defined.
Read the variable definitions from the specified file.
Read the contents of the variable from a the specified file.
Define a comma separated list of values that are used in the dialog that is shown when prompting for variable values.

section.para: More details and examples can be found in the chapter:

section.title: Delete a script variable - WbVarDelete
section.para: This removes an internal variable from the variable list. Details can be found in the chapter .

section.para: This list all defined variables from the variable list. Details can be found in the chapter .
